alert.note: Alert for Kauai North; Kauai Southwest; Kohala; Kona; Lanai Leeward; Maui Central Valley North; Maui Windward West; Molokai North; Molokai West; Molokai Windward; Niihau; Oahu North Shore; Waianae Coast; Windward Haleakala (Hawaii) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Surf Advisory issued January 24 at 3:11PM HST until January 26 at 6:00AM HST by NWS Honolulu
info.description: ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY FOR NORTH AND WEST FACING SHORES OF NIIHAU KAUAI OAHU MOLOKAI NORTH FACING SHORES OF MAUI AND WEST FACING SHORES OF LANAI AND BIG ISLAND... .A moderate, medium period west northwest swell peaks this evening then subsides through Thursday resulting in moderate coastal impacts and surf near the advisory threshold into Thursday night. ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM HST FRIDAY... * WHAT...Surf 10 to 15 feet along smaller island north-facing shores. Surf 8 to 12 feet along smaller island west-facing shores except Maui. Surf 7 to 10 feet along west-facing shores of Big Island. * WHERE...North and west facing shores of Niihau, Kauai, Oahu, Molokai, north-facing shores of Maui, and west-facing shores of the Big Island. * WHEN...Until 6 AM HST Friday. * IMPACTS...Moderate. Strong breaking waves and strong currents will make swimming dangerous.
info.instruction: Heed all advice from ocean safety officials. When in doubt, don`t go out.
